column4: no one know how to enable shmconfig? i thought it was a simple procedure, i have tried to enter it like it said in the ubuntu forum, but obviously i cant do it.
i recall researching that once befor.. its some hal/fdi config file you edit.
i have tried that.  can you direct me to the correct guide, or the one you read?
not really - i researched it for someone ages ago.. I might have it tagged on my delicious links.
alright:) please let me know if you find it again:)
it may be one of the many links i got tagged at --> http://delicious.com/dr_willis
i will check it then:)
i think i found it -->> https://help.ubuntu.com/community/SynapticsTouchpad#shmconfig
thanks, that is the same guide i tried. it is not the hal file guide, it is a link to that on the bottom of that page, but that guide should work, allthough it didnt
no idea. thats all ive tried and it worked.. i recall.

do you recal what you did after you had added the content to the file. or if there was any other content in the file. like could i ask you what you have on that file now, cause mine was blank beofre i added the stuff from this guide
that was a few installs ago.. I dont even thinki have that laptop any more.
thank anyways
how do i install the synpatics touchpad driver?
from what i recall.. its allready installed. its part of the X stuff
that gsynapics tool can help configure it - or at least it used to work...
alright thanks. then i will just add it to my xorg folllowin  guide
some Upodates to X, have broken/changed some things with the synaptics drivers..  not sure how stable they have became lately
ok does that mean i should not add it'?
try gsynaptics - see if it works for you.
ive not had to tweak the touchpads on my new laptops.
gnome-do has a dock like theme+shelf feature.
i am sorry i do not understand, is gnome do a software of some kind then?
i installed gnome do, but how do i start it:D <embarrased>
windowkey-space
time to check the gnome-do homepage/docs :) and  enable the shelf plugin also.
you are probably to busy now, but is it posible to get a walk trough. i could not find that document page on their website
how do i access gnome do settings?
when ya window-space theres a button /menu
top right corner.. a little arrow..
yes i saw it, but gnome closed when i started moving in applications, i found the switch to set it as a dock even, but know it is gone
theres also a setting to have it always show up a systray icon
yes but i can not access the settings know cause i can not find it:(
i enabled that.  the win-space arrow works here if i just win-space then use the mouse
so you are saying win-space dont work any more?
yes that is correct
perhaps gnome-do crashed... rerun the app
any other way of re launching it?
PROPER way to close the terminal.. 'gnome-do &' then use the 'exit' command.. NOT the close button at the top right.
or alt-f2  -> gnome-do
or use gnome-do icon in the menus
accessories -> gnome do
ah ok thanks i have it there now, but the settings arrow is not thre
you changed themes then.. look  about i guess..
i will reinstall it i think
that is 'windows' thinking. and proberly wont change anything
reinstalling an app will NOT reset the users settings
oh ok, yeah i am usualy a windows user:/
is there any other way for me to acces the gnome-do settings?
proberly is.. but i would have to read up at the gnome-do homepage to figure it out
oh ok i see
when ya win-space do you see a systry icon for gnome-do? a purple square with a snowflake in it.
i have already changed theme to docked, so nope it is already there, i can search in it when i press windows space
if using'docked'  i though there was an ICOn in the dock to get to the settings.
you may needed to enable the shelf plugin also
hmm i can not seem to find that one, and the shelf plugin i have a hard time enabling without prefrenses or settings
i found the do preferences, now i activated the shelf plugin, what exactly will it do
dosent seem to do what i thought it did. i though it controlled what was on teh doc.. You found the purple icon on the  docky bar Im guessing?
thers also some way to type 'do-perferances' or somthingto get to the settings but i cant figure that out

no i had to space windows then type preferences, the only way i can access the preferenses, the dock will have a lot of random icons on it, to bad the shelf plugin does not let you put what you want in it
not sure what it does  really - the doc for shelf are a little vague
http://do.davebsd.com/wiki/Docky
thanks
it also rembers/learns what you launch so it puts them first in the list
that is quite interesting, so it actually lets you place icons there and it also detects most used in some sort of way?
top 5 get added.. and you an drag/drop  to/from it..
it seems tobe a better 'dock' then many others ive tried
you can have more than five, just resize docky and it will oopen for many many more
i got a wide desktop.. i can have lots.. :P
i think this gnome do will be very very useful and that you gave me a more complete solutin than just a dock, hope it does not steel to much performance
compared to the total Poopoo i see in other 'docks' its at least useable. :)
agreed, problem solved, thousand thanks, times to move on to my next one, thanks alot!:D
somehow the gnomedo perferances ion got added to the dock now. :)
i have it there because it is my most used one:D
becuase its the most used recently i guess. :)
and i found that you can right click the gnome-do icon and see prefrenses for the gnome do program, pluss some quick settings
yes. :) i was goingto mention that.. but you said you found the perferances allready
i think i figured the shelf function: right click an app there, and you will see it says add to shelf!
yes.. but what is a shelf then?
thats what i never noticed in the docs
i think it is a function that let you bypass most used value and let the app stay untouched in its possition, disregarding the fact that it is used less than top apps
the thing abotu that dock (and docks) ya either clutter up the whole bottom of the screen with lots of icons.. or ya get some desktop space wasted at the sides. :)
guess i could put a gnome pannel to one side. :)
yes and you can take away the function casuing it to stay on top
well i have tried most all the docks.. and i will say - this oneis the most useable..
all the rest never work well.. or are lacking features
and the win-space feature   is the main use.. the dock is a bonus.
the win space is the winning over ALL :)
if you can rember the special words for the plugins...
and i have never seen anything smarter than this lancher/dock, it is my new fav
er.. mounting a partition on the machines hard drive? thats just editing fstab..
which is what i am trying to do(but i am windows user) :)
hmm alright well, let me know if you find a good way of doing it:)
i always pit my ntfs drives in /etc/fstab now a days.. i dont trust gnomes automounting of stuff.. too many issues
then i will as well, problem solved:D
err... thats normal.
run what one you want. :) 3.0 or 3.5
oh ok:)
